ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Critically evaluating dance & writing about motion. Exposure to a wide range of dance -- ballet, contemporary, Odissi, etc. Reading previous literature on dance and applying similar concepts to our own writing.
Learned how to write about dance descriptively. Very detail analysis of dance
I learned a lot about the history of dance and different ways of viewing and interpreting it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: incredibly interesting topic (& this is probably the only class at Yale that really deals with writing about dance); in-depth feedback on writing (from Professor Seibert & other students, as much of the class is spent workshopping); well-facilitated discussions; exposure to diverse styles of dance; really fun class trip
Weaknesses: selected readings are really great, but there wasn't a lot of time at the end of class to discuss them; grading is slightly harsh but fair

The videos were really interesting. The class made me look at dance in a totally different way. The course is hard and it is difficult to write a dance essay without having any background doing it. The assignments are fun but challenging.

I think the interactive format of the course was great. I think something that could be improved is offering a means of improvement - I felt a bit like grades were stagnant throughout the semester and based more on impression of the student rather than the actual work produced.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially if you are interested in dance or writing about movement. Class is well-structured to expose you to many varieties of dance styles and dance writing. Feedback is excellent, as nearly every class dedicates significant time to workshopping each student's essay. Professor Seibert always gives tons of comments as well, and is super nice and incredibly knowledgable about the subject. Workload can be high, however; each essay takes a lot of thought to compose. Grading can also be tough relative to other classes, but it is fair.
This course is really cool if you like dance, but it is hard and Brian expects a lot from you. It will improve your creative writing a lot.
I would recommend this course to another student if they're excited about dance and willing to take a bad grade to enjoy a course.
